metadata.title: CVE-2022-35255 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A weak randomness in WebCrypto keygen vulnerability exists in Node.js 18due to a change with EntropySource() in SecretKeyGenTraits::DoKeyGen() insrc/crypto/crypto_keygen.cc. There are two problems with this: 1) It doesnot check the return value, it assumes EntropySource() always succeeds, butit can (and sometimes will) fail. 2) The random data returnedbyEntropySource() may not be cryptographically strong and therefore notsuitable as keying material.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-35255` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
nodejs - 18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.13.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu2').
